titles.title: Providing for a correction in the enrollment of H.J. Res. 100.
Providing for a correction in the enrollment of H.J. Res. 100.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure, and in addition to the Committee on House Administration, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure, and in addition to the Committee on House Administration, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Railroads, Pipelines, and Hazardous Materials.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1499.
Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 3372, H.R. 6878, H.R. 8876 and H.J. Res. 100. The resolution provides for adoption of H. Res. 1495 and H. Con. Res. 118.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with ten minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 119.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H. Con Res. 119, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the resolution, and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Graves (MO) demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on agreeing to the resolution until a time to be announced.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 221 - 207 (Roll no. 491).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Under the order of 12/1/22, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, failed of passage in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 52 - 43. Record Vote Number: 371.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

term.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

bill.summary: This concurrent resolution provides for seven days of sick leave for railroad employees under the terms of the the most recent tentative agreements, side letters, and local carrier agreements entered into by the parties to the disputes between certain railroads and labor organizations.
